intro: Centaurea ambigua subsp. ambigua, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with yellow centers, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas.
